display_asset.caption: From left, Daniel Radcliffe, Rupert Grint and Emma Watson in “Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2.”

summaries.body: In the London play "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child," a black actress will play adult Hermione. “Rowling loves black Hermione,” J.K. Rowling tweeted.
Writing a holiday card is a lot of work, and New Yorkers are far too busy. So just pick a few of your favorite emoji, and we'll fill in the rest.

display_asset.caption: Zaevion Dobson, 15, was shot to death last Thursday in Knoxville, Tenn.
display_asset.credit: Knox County Schools, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A 15-year-old who died trying to shield his friends from gang gunfire last week has been called a hero by President Obama.
How do presidential candidates deal with unhealthy food at campaign stops? Rand Paul avoids fries. Jeb Bush is a fan of the Paleo diet. And Hillary Clinton enjoys raw jalapeños.

display_asset.caption: An oil platform in the Gulf of Mexico. Higher production from projects in the gulf is offsetting declines in shale oil production on shore.
display_asset.credit: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times

summaries.body: Oil prices hit 11-year lows in Asia and Europe on Monday, as a glut of crude on world markets and the recent global climate accord continue to depress fossil-fuel prices.

display_asset.caption: The cost of 12 drummers drumming, $2,855, has stayed flat in the last two years, in step with slow economic growth.
display_asset.credit: Bishop Nash/The Herald-Dispatch, via Associated Press

summaries.body: The cost of 12 drummers drumming this year? $2,855. An index tracking the gifts in “The 12 Days of Christmas” shows that prices have hardly budged.
An Australian anti-marijuana campaign featuring anthropomorphic “stoner sloths” has been met with hilarity online.

display_asset.caption: Members of the City of Paris’s archival team gather notes, poems and drawings left at a memorial after the Nov. 13 attacks that killed 130 people there.

summaries.body: Archivists in Paris are collecting thousands of letters, drawings and other tokens of grief that have been left at makeshift memorials after the Nov. 13 terrorist attacks.
Elon Musk's company, SpaceX, will attempt to launch and land its most powerful rocket yet on Monday.
Hosting the Miss Universe pageant, Steve Harvey mistakenly announced that Miss Colombia had won before recognizing Miss Philippines as the true winner.

display_asset.caption: A home boarded up for the winter on Commercial Street in Provincetown, Mass.
display_asset.credit: Katherine Taylor for The New York Times

summaries.body: The summer haven of Provincetown, Mass., is threatened by a shrinking, graying population and scarcities of housing and year-round jobs.
Two tenants evicted from rent-stabilized apartments in Los Angeles are suing a landlord after noticing their former apartments were appearing on Airbnb, violating an ordinance.

display_asset.caption: Mourners at a makeshift memorial at the entrance to the Sandy Hook Elementary School in 2012.
display_asset.credit: Marcus Yam for The New York Times

summaries.body: A Florida university is trying to fire a professor who thinks the 2012 Sandy Hook massacre was a hoax. He has been accused of harassing a victim's parents.
Products geared toward women cost 7 percent more than products for men, a study found. Take a quiz to discover the price difference of the above scooters.

display_asset.caption: Safyre Terry received packages from Santa Claus on Thursday in Rotterdam, N.Y.

summaries.body: Safyre Terry has 430,000 Christmas cards, but no one has ever stood trial for the deliberate fire that badly burned the 8-year-old, and killed her father and three siblings.
France passed a bill intended to bar models who are “excessively thin." They’ll need a certificate from a doctor that verifies their health.

display_asset.caption: The shehada is the declaration of faith in Islam and the script is used on the Saudi flag.

summaries.body: Anger over a lesson on Islam has caused a Virginia school district to shut down today. Students were asked to copy the Islamic declaration of faith in Arabic calligraphy.

display_asset.caption: Anthony D. Marshall, embraced by his wife, Charlene, in Criminal Court in June 2013, before he went to prison for stealing millions of dollars from his mother, Brooke Astor.

summaries.body: A legal petition details what it calls "atrocious" treatment at Rikers Island of Anthony Marshall, 89 at the time, who was convicted of stealing from his mother, Brooke Astor.

display_asset.caption: This color-adjusted composite of images taken by NASA's Curiosity rover in September shows the lower portion of Mount Sharp, which Curiosity has been studying for the last 15 months.

summaries.body: As NASA's Curiosity rover climbs the Gale Crater on Mars, changes in the rocks are showing how the climate and the environment changed there more than 3 billion years ago.

display_asset.caption: The current Just Mayo label, top, and the new label below it. The new label will meet the F.D.A.'s guidelines.

summaries.body: The plant-based mayonnaise substitute Just Mayo can keep its name and logo, as long as its label is changed to emphasize that it contains no eggs, the F.D.A. decided.

display_asset.caption: President Obama drank tea made from catkins in a scene from the episode.

summaries.body: President Obama appeared on the survivalist reality show “Running Wild With Bear Grylls” on Thursday in an effort to highlight the perils of climate change.
Kaiser Permanente, aiming to teach its model of integrated care to a new generation of doctors, announced that it would open its own medical school in California in 2019.
Mufid Elfgeeh, the owner of a pizza shop in Rochester who was arrested last year, pleaded guilty to terrorism charges that he was recruiting for the Islamic State.

display_asset.caption: The storage facility where two children were found dead in Redding, Calif.
display_asset.credit: Andreas Fuhrmann/Record Searchlight, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A woman and her teenage companion will face murder charges after two children were found stuffed inside a storage locker. "I’ve never seen such abuse,” a police official said.
The New York City health department cannot require children to get the flu vaccination in order to attend city-licensed preschools and day cares, a judge ruled.

display_asset.credit: Gretchen Ertl for The New York Times

summaries.body: Boston joined the likes of New York City by raising the legal age for buying cigarettes to 21. Massachusetts is considering making it a statewide minimum.
Mast Brothers, a Brooklyn chocolate company, has faced skepticism over its "bean to bar" process. A blogger now says they started out remelting other chocolate.

display_asset.caption: Lawmakers voted to remove four Confederate monuments, including the statue of Gen. Robert E. Lee in a traffic circle, named Lee Circle, in the city’s central business district.

summaries.body: The New Orleans City Council voted 6 to 1 to remove four Confederate monuments after a heated debate, declaring the three statues and an obelisk to be “public nuisances.”

display_asset.caption:
Iman Shumpert, player for the Cavaliers, holds his newborn after helping to deliver.

(no credit)

summaries.body: Iman Shumpert, a player for the Cleveland Cavaliers, delivered the baby when his fiancée went into labor in the bathtub.

display_asset.caption: People posed for photos outside Disneyland in Anaheim, Calif. Metal detectors were installed for the holiday season at several major theme parks.

summaries.body: Disney, SeaWorld and Universal Studios said they would be adding metal detectors for the holiday season. Disney also banned toy guns and costumes.
